New Records: Liam Livingstone scored his first ODI century in a 140-run partnership with Sam Curran, breaking a new record for England
Key Match Events: England successfully chased down 329-5 with 15 balls remaining
Livingstone expertly controlled the chase with key contributions from Sam Curran
Pre-Game Insights: England captain Liam Livingstone won the toss and set up the chase with a solid foundation from Phil Salt and Jacob Bethell
Post-Match Reflections: Livingstone expressed pride in the team's resilience and performance
The match was a significant morale booster ahead of the third and deciding game
Miscellaneous Highlights: Young fast bowler John Turner dismissed key West Indies batsmen early on
West Indies' Shai Hope and Keacy Carty contributed significantly to their innings
Others: The match was played in warm conditions with England using nine bowlers but struggling with dropped catches
